title.narrative: Cultural campaign and sensitizing media to influence policy for older people rights and entitlements

description.narrative: 120 local level cultural groups have an improved capacity to incorporate advocacy and social action into their performances and cultural work

120 local cultural groups, 4500 civil society members and 106 print & electronic media from local and national level, local government in 27 unions of 4 districts, policy makers from different government and non-government sectors and national level civil society organisations. The actions aim to benefit 55,000 older people in the project areas.
Communication and coordination mechanisms are established to link local level cultural actions in 04 districts in Bangladesh to national level policy dialogue processes
Local and national level media stakeholders are actively contributing to debates on ageing and calling for improved social protection for older people

The project aims to strengthen civil society institutions for increased citizen actions to ensure older people's rights and entitlements. Specifically, we aim to strengthen cultural actors, media and civil society to enable them to speak for rights and social protection issues for older people through cultural campaigns.

participating-org.narrative: BSDO - Barendrabhumi Samaj Unnayan Sangstha, Bangl
Bangladesh Resource Centre for Indigenous Knowledg
